intro: Vandellia bonatii, commonly known as the Bonatti's vandella, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and vibrant floral displays. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in cloud forests where it can thrive on rocky substrates. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pink, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Vandellia bonatii is considered a species of conservation concern.
